sn48.57:4.1: At one time, when he was first awakened, the Buddha was staying near Uruvelā at the goatherd’s banyan tree on the bank of the Nerañjarā River.
sn48.57:4.2: Then as he was in private solitude this thought came to his mind:
sn48.57:4.3: “When these five faculties are developed and cultivated they culminate, finish, and end in the deathless.
sn48.57:4.10: When these five faculties are developed and cultivated they culminate, finish, and end in the deathless.”
sn48.57:5.1: Then Brahmā Sahampati knew what the Buddha was thinking.
sn48.57:5.2: As easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm,
sn48.57:5.3: he vanished from the Brahmā realm and reappeared in front of the Buddha.
sn48.57:5.4: He arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his cupped palms toward the Buddha, and said:
sn48.57:5.5: ‘That’s so true, Blessed One! That’s so true, Holy One!
sn48.57:5.6: When these five faculties are developed and cultivated they culminate, finish, and end in the deathless.
sn48.57:5.8: the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, samādhi,
sn48.57:5.10: When these five faculties are developed and cultivated they culminate, finish, and end in the deathless.
sn48.57:6.1: Once upon a time, sir, I lived the spiritual life under the fully awakened Buddha Kassapa.
sn48.57:6.4: Because of developing and cultivating these same five faculties I lost interest in desire for sensual pleasures. When my body broke up, after death, I was reborn in a good place, in the Brahmā realm.
sn48.57:6.7: That’s so true, Blessed One! That’s so true, Holy One!
sn48.57:6.8: I know and see how these five faculties are developed and cultivated they culminate, finish, and end in the deathless.”
